Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • Functions

  • public class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a collection of Functions which deal with Strings and String-Arrays
    Author:
    Robert Adam

      This function will overwrite the element before "=" with "Variable" except that the this element is "Array"

    • Method Detail

      • removeString

        public static java.lang.String removeString(java.lang.String string,
                            java.lang.String removal)
        This function will cut a string out of another string
        Parameters:
        string - The original string
        removal - The string which should be cut form the original
        Returns:
        sFinished The original string which does not contain the removal-string (or at lest one time less)

      • removeFromTo

        public static java.lang.String removeFromTo(java.lang.String string,
                            java.lang.String from,
                            java.lang.String to)
        This function will remove a part of a string from an indicator to another indicator
        Parameters:
        string - The original string which will be modified
        from - The indicator where the removal should start (that contains the indicator itself to be removed)
        to - The indicator where the removal should stop (that contains the indicator itself to be removed)
        Returns:
        sFinished The original string which does not contain the part between the two indicators

      • removeStartBlank

        public static java.lang.String removeStartBlank(java.lang.String string)
        This function will remove all blanks at hte beginning of a string
        Parameters:
        string - The original string which will be modified
        Returns:
        string The original string without any blanks at the beginning

      • howManyElements

        public static int howManyElements(java.lang.String string)
        This function finds out of how many element (either seperated by blanks or sourrounded by brackets) the string consists
        Parameters:
        string - The string where one want to know of how many elements it consists
        Returns:
        quantity The amount of found elements

      • getElements

        public static java.lang.String[] getElements(java.lang.String string)
        This function will return an Array with all the elements (seperated by blanks or sourrounded by brackets) split up to its own Array-value
        Parameters:
        string - The original string which should be splitted up
        Returns:
        Elements The Array which contains all the single elements of the original string

      • printArray

        public static void printArray(java.lang.String[] Array)
        This function will print out the content of an Array (it will display the first Arraycontent then a ":" and then the rest of it)
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array which shall be outlined

      • correctSyntax

        public static java.lang.String[] correctSyntax(java.lang.String[] Array)
        This function will replace the variables standing in "Syntax" with the actual parameters standing "Parameter" ("Syntax" and "Parameter" are created locally)
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array which contains the elements of the Syntax and the parameters
        Returns:
        Syntax The Array which contains the actual Syntax for the command

      • whichPosition

        public static int whichPosition(java.lang.String[] Array,
                java.lang.String element,
                boolean exactValue)
        This function will return the position of an element in an Array
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array which contains the element
        element - the element the function shall search for
        exactValue - Indicates if the function shall search for exactly this element or just for a content which contains the element
        Returns:
        position The position of the element in the Array

      • isIn

        public static boolean isIn(java.lang.String[] Array,
           java.lang.String element,
           boolean exactValue)
        This function will check if an Array contains a specific string
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array which will be searched
        element - The element that will be searched
        exactValue - indicates if the function shall search for exactly this element or just for a content that conatins this element
        Returns:
        match The result of the search (true/false)

      • removeDots

        public static java.lang.String removeDots(java.lang.String string)
        This unction will remove signs like ". , : _ '" from a string as long as these signs aren't included in brackets
        Parameters:
        string - The string where these signs shall be removed
        Returns:
        string The string without these signs except for those between brackets

      • replaceWith

        public static java.lang.String[] replaceWith(java.lang.String[] Array,
                             java.lang.String replace,
                             java.lang.String with)
        This function replaces a content of an String-Array with another string
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array where one element shall be replaced
        replace - The content that shall be replaced
        with - The string that shall replace the "replace"
        Returns:
        Array The original Array with the one element changed

      • filterCommand

        public static java.lang.String[] filterCommand(java.lang.String[] Array)
        Gets the actual command, because sometimes the command has some extra information in it (which this function will remove)
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array with the Syntax
        Returns:
        Array The Array with the Syntax and the correct command

      • changeToVar

        public static java.lang.String[] changeToVar(java.lang.String[] Array)
        This function will overwrite the element before "=" with "Variable" except that the this element is "Array"
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array with the Syntax
        Returns:
        Array The Array with the Syntax and the right Variablenames

      • markCommand

        public static java.lang.String markCommand(java.lang.String string,
                           java.lang.String command)
        This function will write the command in the html-line in uppercase letters
        Parameters:
        string - The html-line with the command
        command - The command that shall be highlighted
        Returns:
        string The html-line with the highlighted command-part

      • findPos

        public static int[] findPos(java.lang.String string,
            java.lang.String element)
        This function will find the start- and endposition of an element inside of a string
        Parameters:
        string - The string which conatins the element
        element - the element the function shall search for
        Returns:
        Position An Array which contains the start- and endposition (in that order)

      • unmarkCommand

        public static java.lang.String[] unmarkCommand(java.lang.String[] Array,
                               java.lang.String command)
        This function will write the command in lowercase letters
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array with the Syntax
        command - The command that shall be unhighlighted
        Returns:
        Array The Array with the Syntax and the unmarked command

      • cutFrom

        public static java.lang.String[] cutFrom(java.lang.String[] Array,
                         java.lang.String cut,
                         boolean exactValue)
        This function will cut an Array from an element to the end
        Parameters:
        Array - The original Array
        cut - The element which indicates the cut
        exactValue - indicates if the Arraycontent which indicates the cut has to be exactly "cut" or just has to contain "cut"
        Returns:
        Array1 The cut Array

      • turnInto

        public static java.lang.String turnInto(java.lang.String string,
                        java.lang.String element,
                        java.lang.String letter)
        This function will write an eelement in an string in upper- or lowercase letters
        Parameters:
        string - The original string
        element - The element that shall be modified
        letter - If "UP" the element will be changed to uppercase letters. If "LOW" the element will be changed to lowercase letters
        Returns:
        string The original string with the modified element

      • getArrayContentFrom

        public static java.lang.String[] getArrayContentFrom(java.lang.String[] Array,
                                     int pos)
        This function will get the Arraycontent from a position to the end
        Parameters:
        Array - The original Array
        pos - The position that indicates the content-collectiion
        Returns:
        Array2 An Array which consists of all the elements between "pos" and the end of the original Array

      • correctAlternativeSyntax

        public static java.lang.String[] correctAlternativeSyntax(java.lang.String[] Array)
        This function will correct an alternative Syntax (a second or even a third/fourth/etc.)
        Parameters:
        Array - the Array with the syntax in it
        Returns:
        Syntax An Array with the alternative Syntax

      • ArrayToString

        public static java.lang.String ArrayToString(java.lang.String[] Array)
        This function will convert a String-Array into a string
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array that shall be transformed
        Returns:
        string The string with the Arraycontent

      • correctBrackets

        public static java.lang.String correctBrackets(java.lang.String string,
                               java.lang.String[] Parameter)
        This function will recognize if the Parameter of the form [para1, para2, ...] are listed seperately in the Parameters or if it's just an Array
        Parameters:
        string - The element with brackets, that might be an Array
        Parameter - The Parameter Array
        Returns:
        string The result of the research (either every single element replaced or replaced as a whole as an Array)

      • getArraycontentFromTo

        public static java.lang.String[] getArraycontentFromTo(java.lang.String[] Array,
                                       int startPos,
                                       int endPos)
        This Function will get the Arraycontent between two positions
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array which contains the content the function shall collect
        startPos - The position, where extracting shall start
        endPos - The position, where extracting shall end
        Returns:
        ArrayR The Array with the wanted content

      • checkReturn

        public static java.lang.String[] checkReturn(java.lang.String[] Array)
        This function will check if a variable declaration has got a return-value. If yes it will give the variable the name of its return-value
        Parameters:
        Array - The Array with the Syntax
        Returns:
        Array The Array with the Syntax and the corrected Variablename
